src:
Podkupljen, da so nabavili aligatorje
Zdravnik Zoran Miloševič in Irma Košutar Gašparić obsojena na pogojno kazen.
01 Nov 2019, 18:43 by Jure Predanič



Sodišče ne dvomi, da je Zoran Miloševič vrhunski strokovnjak, a je nedvomno vzel podkupnino. FOTO: Marko Feist



Obtoženi je poskrbel, da je UKC nabavil pripomočke od podjetja Animus. FOTO: Dejan Javornik


LJUBLJANA – Zdravnik nevroradiolog Zoran Miloševič z Univerzitetnega kliničnega centra Ljubljana (UKC) je vrhunski strokovnjak in je zelo prizadet zaradi očitkov tožilstva, da je od podjetja Emporio Medical prejel 114.700 evrov podkupnine in od tega opral 28.500 evrov, je bilo slišati pred dnevi na ljubljanskem okrožnem sodišču.


Obtoženi je poskrbel, da je UKC nabavil pripomočke od podjetja Animus. FOTO: Dejan Javornik

V tem postopku se bo še zagovarjal, nov črn dan pa je bil za zdravnika včeraj, saj ga je senat pod predsedstvom sodnika Srečka Škerbca v ločenem postopku obsodil, ker je podkupnino vzel od podjetja Animus pred 10 leti.Zaradi nedovoljenega sprejemanja daril so Miloševiča obsodili na 10 mesecev zapora, a mu za zapahe ne bo treba, če v dveh letih ne bo storil novega kaznivega dejanja. Soobtožena Irma Košutar Gašparić iz podjetja Animus pa je bila zaradi nedovoljenega dajanja daril obsojena na eno leto in pol pogojne zaporne kazni s tremi leti preizkusne dobe.Obtožena sta se znašla na zatožni klopi, ker je konec leta 2008 in leta 2009 podjetje Animus Miloševiču v več nakazilih plačalo 7200 evrov.Te mu bo, če bo kazen postala pravnomočna, sodišče tudi odvzelo. Miloševič je namreč poskrbel, da je UKC Ljubljana pri Animusu naročil medicinski pripomoček, imenovan aligator, ki se uporablja za zdravljenje možganske kapi, Animus pa je bil ekskluzivni distributer tega pripomočka.Miloševič je očitke zavrnil, med drugim je povedal, da ni bil vključen v sistem nabave medicinskega pripomočka, da ni podpisoval naročilnic ali se dogovarjal za ceno.To je počela komisija, on je le vložil vlogo za pripomoček. Za podjetje Animus pa je predaval o koristnosti uporabe medicinskih izdelkov in zato tudi prejel plačilo za opravljeno delo prek svojega s. p. Zagovornik Milan Krstić, ki je sodišču predlagal izrek oprostilne sodbe, je poudaril, da je izdelek, ki ga je naročil, revolucionaren za zdravljenje možganske kapi, zato naročilo ni sporno. Da ni šlo za podkupovanje, je trdila tudi Irma Košutar Gašparić, tudi njen zagovornik Janez Koščak pa je sodišču predlagal, naj ji izreče oprostilno sodbo.A je bolj zadovoljen sodišče zapustil tožilec Iztok Krumpak. Sodišče mu ni sledilo v predlogu višine kazni, za Miloševiča je namreč zahteval štiri mesece zapora (ki se lahko nadomestijo z delom v splošno korist) in plačilo stranske kazni 6000 evrov, za soobtoženo pa je predlagal dva meseca zapora in 1400 evrov stranske kazni.»Res je, da gre za vrhunskega strokovnjaka in zdravnika, in verjamemo, da je res predan pacientom,« se je z obrambo strinjal sodnik Škerbec. A je senat ocenil, da je nedvomno zagrešil kaznivo dejanje, in za napake je treba pač plačati, je poudaril sodnik. Sodnik se je odzval tudi na očitke obrambe, da sodišče ni sprejelo veliko dokazov obrambe, ker je hitelo zaradi grožnje, da bo postopek zastaral.
Sodnik se je ostro odzval na očitke, da gre za čarovniški proces zoper zdravnike.
Kot je povedal, postopek zastara 16. septembra, zaradi česar ga je bilo res treba hitro izpeljati, je pa sodišče izvedlo vse dokaze, ki so bili po mnenju senata potrebni za razjasnitev dejanskega stanja, nepotrebne dokazne predloge pa je zavrnilo.Ostro pa se je sodnik odzval na očitke, da gre za nekakšen čarovniški proces zoper zdravnike, ki so se v zadnjem času znašli na tapeti. Z zadevo se bo torej zagotovo ukvarjalo še višje sodišče, ki pa nima veliko časa za odločitev.
text:
Bribed for procuring alligators
Doctor Zoran Milosevic and Irma Kosutar Gasparic sentenced to probation.
01 Nov 2019, 18:43 by Jure Predanic



The court has no doubt that Zoran Milosevic is a top expert, but he has undoubtedly taken a bribe. PHOTO: Marko Feist



The defendant made sure that UKC procured supplies from Animus. PHOTO: Dejan Javornik


LJUBLJANA - Neuroradiologist Zoran Milosevic from the University Clinical Center Ljubljana (UKC) is a top expert and is deeply affected by allegations from the prosecution that he received $ 114,700 in bribes from Emporio Medical, of which he washed $ 28,500, it was heard days ago in the Ljubljana District the court.


The defendant made sure that UKC procured supplies from Animus. PHOTO: Dejan Javornik

He will continue to defend himself in the proceedings, but a new black day for the doctor was yesterday, as he was sentenced by a senate presided over by Judge Srecko Skerbc in a separate trial for taking a bribe from Animus 10 years ago. to 10 months in prison, but he won't need to latch unless he commits another crime within two years. The co-accused Irma Kosutar Gašparić of Animus was sentenced to one and a half years of probation with three years of probation for unauthorized giving of gifts. The defendants found themselves on the bench because, at the end of 2008 and 2009, Animus Milosevic was in more he will pay EUR 7200. If the sentence becomes final, the court will also revoke him. Milosevic made sure that UKC Ljubljana had ordered from Animus a medical device called an alligator used to treat stroke, and Animus was the exclusive distributor of the device. Milosevic dismissed the allegations, saying that he was not included in the the system of purchasing a medical device that he did not sign orders or negotiate for a price. That's what the commission was doing, he just applied for the device. For Animus, however, he lectured on the usefulness of using medical products and therefore received payment for the work done through his s. p. Advocate Milan Krstic, who applied to the court for a judgment of acquittal, stressed that the product he had ordered was revolutionary for the treatment of stroke, so the order was not in dispute. Irma Košutar Gašparić also claimed that it was not a bribe, and her lawyer Janez Koščak also asked the court to pronounce her acquittal.A prosecutor Iztok Krumpak left the more satisfied court. The court did not follow him in his sentence, for Milosevic demanded four months' imprisonment (which can be replaced by work in the general interest) and payment of a sideline fine of EUR 6,000; It is true that he is a top expert and a doctor, and we believe he is truly committed to patients, ”Judge Škerbec agreed with his defense. But the Senate estimated that he had committed the crime without a doubt, and the mistakes had to be paid for, the judge said. The judge also responded to the defense's allegations that the court did not admit much of the defense's evidence because it was rushed by the threat that the proceedings would be time-barred.
The judge reacted sharply to the allegations that it was a witchcraft process against doctors.
He said the statute of limitations had expired on September 16, which really had to be carried out quickly, but the court presented all the evidence which, according to the Senate, was necessary to clarify the facts, and rejected unnecessary motions. the judge responded to allegations that it was some sort of witchcraft process against doctors who had recently been found on the wallpaper. The case will therefore certainly be dealt with by a higher court, but it does not have much time to decide.
